result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Morris Edward Brown

records.addlTxt: Debra Nelson
Pre-trial conference on January 4, 2023 at 11:15 am.
Initial Scheduling Order

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:56  AM Defendant Morris Edward Brown appeared by video.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Morris Edward Brown.  Attorney Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Johnson asks Court to take judicial notice of Dane County cases 18CF1115, 20CF2074 and 21cf2619. Attorney Fitzgerald does not object. Officer Dillon Hagstrom of Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed adding new charge, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Attorney Fitzgerald states he is filing a substitution of Judge electronically and stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
